segments.text: I see a woman drying dishes, completely oblivious to the chaos around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: There's water everywhere, overflowing from the sink and forming a huge puddle on the floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice she's already standing in the water, but she doesn't seem to care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her focus is solely on that plate, like it's the most important thing in the world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think she must be really tired or just really loves drying dishes.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The kids are being so sneaky, and she has no idea.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she'll notice when the water starts dripping from the ceiling.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like I should say something, but maybe she needs a moment of peace.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's kind of funny, but also a bit sad to see her so out of touch with her surroundings.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope no one gets hurt because of her inattentiveness.
segments.speaker: PAR
